Potential (intrinsic energy of inertia)

Electric Potential $U$:
$$\begin{split} &
e = \textnormal{electron charge} \qquad
q = ne = \textnormal{charge} \qquad
n \in \mathbb{N}
\end{split}$${#eq-potentia-1}

$$\begin{split} &
U = 
\frac{E_{pot}}{q} = 
\frac{m}{q}c^2 = 
\kappa c^2
\end{split}$${#eq-potential-2}


Voltage (potential difference, tension):

$$\begin{split} &
V = 
\Delta U = 
d \cdot \mathscr{E} = 
Z \cdot I = 
...
\qquad Z = \textnormal{Resistance}
\end{split}$${#eq-potential-3}

$$\begin{split} &
E_{kin}^{max} = 
eV_0 = 
h(\nu - \nu_0)
\end{split}$${#eq-potential-4}
